subject: Marathon Running
lead_paragraph: Alex Zanardi, the Italian racecar driver who lost both legs in a 200-mile-an-hour crash in 2001, said he would compete in the wheelchair division of the New York City Marathon on Nov. 4. Zanardi, then 34, was leading the American Memorial 500 in Germany when his Honda Reynard was hit by the car of Alex Tagliani of Canada. Zanardi’s car was split in half and flew into the air. Zanardi’s legs were amputated at the knees, but 20 months later he returned to the track, drove 13 laps and reached 195 m.p.h. during a race. He used a hand control for the clutch and throttle. An artificial right leg, fitted to a special pedal, operated the brake.
